issue.title: Insert actors from the left panel

content.html:
This patch allows it to insert an actor (like this one for example) from the left panel, but the preview is a sphere and the clicked pose is ignored by the animation, which is hardcoded in the actor.

diff -r ddbff1c9bcb0 gazebo/gui/ModelMaker.cc
--- a/gazebo/gui/ModelMaker.cc  Tue Jun 21 09:26:34 2016 -0700
+++ b/gazebo/gui/ModelMaker.cc  Thu Jun 23 10:58:39 2016 -0700
@@ -188,9 +188,11 @@
     modelElem = this->dataPtr->modelSDF->Root()->GetElement("model");
   else if (this->dataPtr->modelSDF->Root()->HasElement("light"))
     modelElem = this->dataPtr->modelSDF->Root()->GetElement("light");
+  else if (this->dataPtr->modelSDF->Root()->HasElement("actor"))
+    modelElem = this->dataPtr->modelSDF->Root()->GetElement("actor");
   else
   {
-    gzerr << "No model or light in SDF\n";
+    gzerr << "No model, actor or light in SDF\n";
     return false;
   }

@@ -216,6 +218,10 @@
   {
     this->dataPtr->modelVisual->AttachMesh("unit_sphere");
   }
+  else if (modelElem->GetName() == "actor")
+  {
+    this->dataPtr->modelVisual->AttachMesh("unit_sphere");
+  }
   else
   {
     return false;
@@ -357,6 +363,10 @@
     {
       modelElem = this->dataPtr->modelSDF->Root()->GetElement("model");
     }
+    else if (this->dataPtr->modelSDF->Root()->HasElement("actor"))
+    {
+      modelElem = this->dataPtr->modelSDF->Root()->GetElement("actor");
+    }
     else
     {
       gzerr << "Couldn't find model element in sdf, won't create entity."

issue.title: Insert actors from the left panel

content.raw: Given that actors can have hardcoded trajectories within the SDF, it might be more interesting to have a dedicated dialog to insert actors and define a trajectory (possibly skin and animation files as well), which generates the SDF on the fly, rather than inserting them from the left panel using  static SDF like is done for models.
content.html: Given that actors can have hardcoded trajectories within the SDF, it might be more interesting to have a dedicated dialog to insert actors and define a trajectory (possibly skin and animation files as well), which generates the SDF on the fly, rather than inserting them from the left panel using static SDF like is done for models.
